arts.ttl: Ruben Selles bemoans Hull City's lack of cutting edge as Tigers suffer narrow Watford loss
arts.sum: City had 16 attempts on goal with only five on target, but rarely looked like breaking down a resolute Watford rearguard, and once Moussa Sissoko turned in 10 minutes into the second half, it had a similar feeling to the 1-0 home loss to Luton Town at the end of March. Ruben Selles bemoaned Hull City's lack of cutting edge in the final third as his side were beaten 1-0 by Watford to leave the Tigers just two points above the relegation zone with five games left to play.

arts.ttl: Five talking points as Sissoko seals Watford victory
arts.sum: Watford’s chances of making the play-offs may be realistically over but the Hornets put Saturday’s disappointment at Bristol City behind them to beat Hull City 1-0 at Vicarage Road tonight.

arts.ttl: Watford win dents Hull’s survival bid
arts.sum: Moussa Sissoko scored the only goal in the second half.
How the game at Vicarage Road unfolded as Moussa Sissoko's goal was enough to beat Hull City.

arts.ttl: Below-par Hull City fail to deliver again as shot-shy Tigers beaten at Watford
arts.sum: Another poor start to the second half saw City allow one-time transfer target Jeremey Ngakia twice shoot wide of Pandur's goal after he was allowed to roam free, while Vata was being afforded similar space to move about and run at the defence. Selles made four changes to his side who snatched that dramatic late winner at Hillsborough on Saturday, with Alfie Jones, Steven Alzate, Lincoln and Matt Crooks all coming back into the side with John Egan, Kyle Joseph and Abu Kamara dropping to the bench.

arts.ttl: Hull City player ratings as poor Tigers fall to narrow Watford defeat
arts.sum: They were a goal down early in the second half when Moussa Sissoko turned in from Caleb Wiley's cross after some pretty shoddy defending from the Tigers, and in truth, they never looked like getting back into the game and the wait for consecutive victories continues. The Tigers almost found themselves a goal down inside a minute when Edo Kayembe was allowed to run towards the box unchallenged before letting rip with an absolute piledriver which cannoned down off the underside of the bar before being hacked away.

arts.ttl: Watford FC fan banned from football matches after Luton Town game
arts.sum: A Watford FC fan has been banned from football matches after The Hornets’ victory over Luton Town.

arts.ttl: Hull City boss makes major Championship claim as Tigers head to Watford
arts.sum: For the eighth time under Selles, City have the chance to make it successive wins and never has the need been greater with just six games of the season go to, and the Tigers three points above the relegation zone. Hull City will take their quest to win successive games under Ruben Selles for the first time in the Championship to Watford on Tuesday night, knowing three points at Vicarage Road will take them another big step closer to safety.

arts.ttl: Tim Sherwood sends Ruben Selles advice as Hull City target Watford success
arts.sum: And it's that experience of dealing with high-pressure situations which Tim Sherwood believes will stand Selles in good stead as he looks to keep City in the Championship in the remaining six games of the season, with the Tigers facing the pundit's former club, Watford, at Vicarage Road on Tuesday night. As a manager in this league, you just have to be really calm about it and just speak to the hierarchy, see what the objectives are, then it’s about trying to meet them.

arts.ttl: Watford injury latest regarding key man Giorgi Chakvetadze ahead of Hull City clash
arts.sum: Watford will assess Giorgi Chakvetadze ahead of their clash against Hull City, as per their official club website.… The post Watford injury latest regarding key man Giorgi Chakvetadze ahead of Hull City clash appeared first on The72 - Football League News.
